channel.title: dev-env on C & C++ FAQ
channel.description: Recent content in dev-env on C & C++ FAQ

item.title: How do I enable compiler warnings?
item.description: For gcc and clang users Add -Wall -Wextra to your compilation flags, enable -Werror so your compiler will treat warnings as errors, also you may need to enable -pedantic to disable gnu extensions (Note that, contrary to what the name -Wall may imply, this does not enable all warnings, but it does enable most of the important ones.) For Visual Studio users Unlike gcc and clang, Visual Studio does enable some warnings by default.
